entry.title: The Operation of Air Services in the Community Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for implementing Chapters I to III of Regulation (EC) No 1008/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24th September 2008 on common rules for the operation of air services in the Community (OJ L 293, 31.10.08, p. 3).

entry.title: The Home Information Pack (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Home Information Pack (No. 2) Regulations 2007 (SI 2007/1667) (“the principal Regulations”). Under sections 155 to 159 of the Housing Act 2004, a home information pack must comply with the principal Regulations.

title.div: The Local Government (Assistants for Political Groups) (Remuneration) (Wales) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn Llywodraeth Leol (Cynorthwywyr i Grwpiau Gwleidyddol) (Tâl) (Cymru) 2009

div.p: One of the requirements relating to the terms on which a person is appointed to, or holds, an appointment in pursuance of section 9 of the Local Government and Housing Act 1989 (assistants for political groups) is that the annual rate of remuneration for the post is less than £13,500 or such higher amount as may be specified by Order made by the Welsh Ministers.

Un o'r gofynion ynghylch y telerau y penodir person i swydd, neu fod person yn dal swydd, yn unol ag adran 9 o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol a Thai 1989 (cynorthwywyr i grwpiau gwleidyddol) yw bod cyfradd y tâl blynyddol ar gyfer y swydd yn llai na £13,500 neu'n swm uwch yn ôl yr hyn a bennir drwy Orchymyn a wneir gan Weinidogion Cymru.

entry.title: The Barking, Havering and Redbridge Hospitals National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Amendment Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Barking, Havering and Redbridge Hospitals National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 2000 (“the Establishment Order”), which established the Barking, Havering and Redbridge Hospitals National Health Service Trust.

entry.title: The Public Health etc. (Scotland) Act 2008 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Public Health etc. (Scotland) Act 2008 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Local Government (Constituting a Joint Committee) Order (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into operation on 14th February 2009, provides for the establishment of seven rural development joint council committees to deliver Axes 3 and 4 of the Northern Ireland Rural Development Programme 2007-2013. In each case, the name and composition of the joint committee are established.

title.div: The Education and Inspections Act 2006 (Commencement No. 2) (Wales) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn Deddf Addysg ac Arolygiadau 2006 (Cychwyn Rhif 2) (Cymru) 2009

div.p: The Order brings section 55 of the Education and Inspections Act 2006 (the 2006 Act) into force on 9 February 2009.
Mae'r Gorchymyn yn dod ag adran 55 o Ddeddf Addysg ac Arolygiadau 2006 (Deddf 2006) i rym ar 9 Chwefror 2009.

entry.title: The Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007 (Transitory Provisions in Consequence of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments in consequence of provisions made by virtue of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (“the 2006 Act”).

entry.title: Rural Development (Financial Assistance) (Public Expenditure) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 25th February 2009, provide for assistance to be paid towards operations which promote rural development.

entry.title: The Animal By-Products (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Animal By-Products (Scotland) Regulations 2003 (the “ABP Regulations”).

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2009

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This is the fifth Commencement Order made under the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (“the Act”). Article 2 brings into force section 2 of the Act for the purposes of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Transitory Provisions) Order 2008 (“the Transitory Order”), as well as related provisions in Schedule 3 to the Act, which makes provision relating to barring. These provisions relate to the maintenance of a children’s barred list and an adults’ barred list and the process by which a person may be included in, or removed from, either list.

entry.title: The Scottish Register of Tartans Act 2008 (Commencement) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order appoints 5th February 2009 as the day on which the Scottish Register of Tartans Act 2008, except section 18, will come into force. Section 18 relates to commencement and short title and came into force on Royal Assent, which was granted on 13th November 2008.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Charges for Drugs and Appliances) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations which apply to England amend the National Health Service (Charges for Drugs and Appliances) Regulations 2000 to provide an exemption from charges for the supply of drugs or appliances for cancer patients.

entry.title: The Scottish Register of Tartans Fees Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order sets out the fees payable for services provided by the Keeper of the Scottish Register of Tartans.

entry.title: The Education (Admissions Appeals Arrangements) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations make a minor amendment to the Education (Admissions Appeals Arrangements) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2008 so as to correct a discrepancy between the commencement of those Regulations and the application of the revised School Admission Appeals Code.

entry.title: The Plant Health (Import Inspection Fees) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Plant Health (Import Inspection Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2005 (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations implement Article 13d of Council Directive 2000/29/EC on protective measures against the introduction into the Community of organisms harmful to plants or plant products and against their spread within the Community (O.J. No. L 169, 10.7.00, p.1), which requires member States to charge fees to cover the costs occasioned by the documentary checks, identity checks and plant health checks of certain imports of plants, plant products and other objects from third countries.

entry.title: The Offender Management Act 2007 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order brings into force certain provisions of the Offender Management Act 2007. Article 2 commences in England and Wales provisions for the use in criminal proceedings of evidence from polygraph sessions from 19th January 2009.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Transitory Provisions) Order 2009

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Transitory Provisions) Order 2008

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order, made under the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (“the Act”), makes provision relating to the functions of the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) (which is established under section 1 of the Act) during the “relevant period”. The relevant period is defined in article 1 as the period starting on the day after the Order is made and ending on the day that section 3 of the Act comes into force for all purposes. The beginning of that period marks the point from which IBB starts to replace the Secretary of State as the body which decides who should be barred from working with children and/or vulnerable adults.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Prescribed Criteria and Miscellaneous Provisions) Regulations 2009

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Prescribed Criteria and Miscellaneous Provisions) Regulations 2008

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the criteria which determine whether a person should be included automatically in the children’s barred list or the adults’ barred list maintained by the Independent Barring Board under section 2 of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (c. 47) (the Independent Barring Board is established under section 1 of that Act).

entry.title: The Income-related Benefits (Subsidy to Authorities) Amendment Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Income-related Benefits (Subsidy to Authorities) Order 1998, (“the 1998 Order”), which provides for the calculation and payment of housing benefit and council tax benefit subsidy to local authorities in England, Wales and Scotland which administer those benefits. Sections 140C(4) and 140F(2) of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 authorise the making or varying of an Order before, during or after the year to which it relates.
